body_content.explanation: an act of someone looking into the distance and appearing not to be noticing or emotionally involved with what is going on around them, typical of someone who has suffered severe emotional shock :
examples: He had survived, but his eyes had acquired the thousand-yard stare of men who had been fighting at the front for too long.
When she felt like this, she would clutch her head or sit with a thousand-yard stare, looking at nothing in particular for hours on end.
The returning soldiers had the thousand yard stare of people who have seen terrible things.
